channel.title: Math on Math Life
channel.description: Recent content in Math on Math Life

item.title: Experimental Number Theory
item.description: This book, published in 2007, is a discussion of various mathematical experiments in Number Theory using the computer. The main computational tool used is the sophisticated package PARI-GP. Maybe the best way to describe the book in more detail is to just quote its preface. Preface -------- There is a long and distinguished tradition in mathematics, perhaps even more pronounced in number theory, whereas a chance discovery of a pattern or identity between numbers arising from unrelated calculations leads to the development of whole new fields (this is precisely how Gauss phrases it in a diary entry).

item.title: Research Articles
item.description: Below you can access all my math research articles. Most of them are published but not all. Bibliography Quaternionic extensions Rodriguez Villegas, F. (in Spanish). In: Proceedings of the IV Coloquio Latinoamericano De Algebra, Mendoza, Argentina, (1984). Quaternionic extensions and rotations Rodriguez Villegas, F. (In Spanish). Notas De La Sociedad Matemática De Chile, 5(1), 201–202, (1986). Relations between quadratic forms and certain Galois extensions Rodriguez Villegas, F. (Unpublished). (1987). On the square root of special values of certain L-series Rodriguez Villegas, F.
